description: The missile test is understood to come as part of North Korea's retaliation to manoeuvres being carried out by the United States, Japan and South Korea

North Korea has tested a “tsunami” nuclear missile capable of taking out enemy fleets.
Reports out of Russia claim that Kim Jong-un's isolationist nation has given its Haeil-5-23 underwater nuclear weapon system a run out. The Japan Sea launch, according to Russian outlet Tass, came in response to the United States, Japan and South Korea carrying out military exercises, which the DPRK said were "seriously threatening the security".
The Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) explained: “From January 15, for three days, the American nuclear-powered aircraft carrier Carl Vinson, the cruiser Princeton, equipped with the Aegis multifunctional combat system, ships of the Japanese Self-Defense Forces and the Republic of Korea Navy again conducted joint naval exercises at sea around Jeju Island.”
READ MORE: 'Worst place to live in UK' has misery doubled as it's named 'most unhealthy in Britain'
Get the latest news on the Daily Star homepage.
North Korea said the moves "constituted a cause of further destabilising the regional situation, and they are an act of seriously threatening the security".
This, in turn, is understood to have led to the Institute of Underwater Weapons Systems at the National Defense Academy of the DPRK to carry out the test. It is reported that this comes as the underwater readiness of North Korea’s underwater nuclear arsenal is approaching readiness. The aim of this, the news network claims, is to provide: "various responses above and below sea will continue to deter hostile military actions by the US Navy and its allies."
(Image: AFP via Getty Images)
In March of last year, North Korea was reported by Voice of Korea Radio, to have tested underwater drones that are able to detect a nuclear charge.
This alternative version of the Haeil, which means tsunami in Korean. Pyongyang claimed the weapons would be able to create an underwater tsunami.

title: North Korea fires 'super powerful tsunami nuke' that moves underwater to wipe out fleets
